intro: Erigeron deamii, commonly known as the Deam's fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It features a basal rosette of leaves and produces yellow disk flowers surrounded by white to pale blue ray florets. Erigeron deamii is often found in California and is adapted to thrive in arid and semi-arid environments.
